ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: those who are humble in their salat;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Who are humble in their service,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: those who, in their Prayers, humble themselves;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who are submissive to God in their prayers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Those who humbly cry in their prayers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Those who with their Salah are Khashi`un.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Who are humble in their prayers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: who in their prayers are humble
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Who are humble in their prayers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: those who are humble in their prayer;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Those who in their prayer are lowly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —those who are humble in their prayers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Those who humble themselves in their prayers;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Those who offer their Salat (prayers) with all solemnity and full submissiveness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: who are humble in their prayers;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Those who are humble in their prayers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:2] those who in their prayers are humble,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Then Allah mentioned the traits of the believers, saying: (Who are humble in their prayers) turning neither to the right nor to the left, nor raise their hands while praying,
